title: Is there any destination like the Faroe Islands, but easier to reach, except Iceland? - Quora

response.answer_text: Norway or the islands north west of Scotland shares some of the: “It’s a nice fresh wind” when every other nationality says it is dangerous to be outside. Allthough there is a different language spoken. The north sea islands have a destinct way of living with the knowledge that tomorrow might spell disaster. It is a tough climate. Low grass is often as tall as any plant can possible reach to catch the suns life. Norway is expensive. So the Shetland Islands might be the cheaper solution. Getting to the Faroe Islands is not that difficult. Just get to Denmark and there is regular ferry or plane connections. Cheap however they are not

Not really. Aditionally to places mentioned in other posts you can try Svalbard. Some other idea can be to try lake Bajkal in Siberia or Tajekistan or Kyrgizstan for interesting landscape without to many tourists.
